content: the scrap bag s h e c r a f t s l o v e sizes s m l measurements approx 9 cm x 10 cm 13 cm x 15 cm 18 cm x 21 cm yarn fingering + lace held together i have not taken approximate yarn measurements but it takes very very little for the smallest size thus why it has been dubbed the scrap bag the larger sizes may require more yardage gauge 25 sts x 35 row = 10 cm x 10 cm 4 in x 4 in in stockinette stitch needles 3 0 mm us 2 5 // 80 cm or 100 cm needles 32 inches or 40 inches to use the magic loop method 2 5 mm crochet hook to make drawstrings or whichever size you need to make a tight crochet chain other notions tapestry needle extra scrap yarn or spare circular needles to hold stitches optional ribbon or any other string type for the drawstring closure fabric to line the bag depending on the fabric your yarn combination creates you may need a lining to preserve the delicateness of the yarn some yarns are more robust than others not requiring a lining construction please read through all of the directions before starting the scrap bag is worked seamlessly from the bottom-up in the round until the body of the bag is completed the stitches are then divided evenly into two sections and a folded hem is worked on both sides of the bag finally simple crochet drawstrings are created and inserted through the folded hems to create a closure you may also choose to knit i-cord drawstrings for the larger bags ribbon or any other drawstring alternative may be used as well for drawstrings this bag is highly customizable you can cast on as few or many stitches as you like you can knit the bag as large or small as you like so long as the drawstring mechanism is still functional 1 to begin using 3 0 mm needles cast on 48 72 96 stitches using judy s magic cast-on you will have 24 36 48 stitches on each needle judy s magic cast-on https //www youtube com/watch v=gv9uafgz6q0 begin knitting in the round using the magic loop method until the bag s height measures approximately 8 5 11 5 17 5 cm or until you ve reached the desired length from the cast-on edge you may use a stitch marker to mark the bor if you d like magic loop method https //www youtube com/watch v=1mqiqrdjc68 folded hems you will now work the folded hems on both sides of the bag the stiches will already be evenly divided between two needles start on one side of bag and let the stiches on the other side rest starting on the first side rs work back and forth in stockinette stitch across the 24 36 48 stitches until the piece measures approximately 11 5 14 5 25 cm for neat edges
